questions.question: The Emancipation Proclamation was an order from Lincoln

choices.answer: requiring slaves to join Union troops
calling for all Confederate slaves to be freed
ending slavery in the United States

questions.question: What was President Lincoln's main goal when he took office in 1861?

choices.answer: to assist the poor in the U.S. and lessen the national debt
to improve relations and trade with foreign countries
to reunite the North and South and keep the Union intact
to abolish slavery everywhere in the U.S.

questions.question: Which of these events marked the beginning of the Civil War?

choices.answer: the election of Abraham Lincoln to the presidency
the abolition of slavery in the South
the declaration of war from President Lincoln
the firing of Confederate guns on Fort Sumter

questions.question: The South expected support from Britain and France because they relied on the South for what?
During the Civil War many women

choices.answer: provided medical care for injured soldiers in the war
began military service after Lincoln granted permission
took over the jobs held by their husbands in factories

questions.question: Together the Union and Confederate armies suffered more than 23,000 casualties in 12 hours at
What's the term for a Union citizen who sympathized with the Confederacy?
Where did General Robert E. Lee surrender to General Ulysses S. Grant?
What feature made the new warships developed by the South dangerous to the Union navy?

choices.answer: they could sail undetected for long periods of time
they were heavily armored with thick metal plating
they could be completely submerged underwater
they moved very fast and could carry loads of ammunition

questions.question: What was the purpose of the Gettysburg Address?

choices.answer: honor the Union Soldiers and their bravery in the Civil War
surrender to certain demands of the Confederacy
remind Americans of the reasons the Civil War was fought
to declare the official end of the Civil War

questions.question: Which of these cities was the capital of the Confederacy?
Leadership of which two generals was a key factor in the Confederates' early military success?

choices.answer: Ambrose Burnside and Ulysses S. Grant
Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson

questions.question: Habeas Corpus means

choices.answer: The right to know your charges and be seen in court
The right to a fair trial

questions.question: Who was the first president of the Confederate States of America?
What was the significance of the Battle of Antietam?

choices.answer: shifted control of the Civil War from the South to the North
the last battle that took place in the eastern U.S.
convinced Europe to support the Confederacy

questions.question: In what way did African American soldiers face more difficulties than white soldiers?

choices.answer: given rotten food to eat and poor living conditions
often killed or sold as a slave if Confederates caught them
not experienced at war and did not know what to expect
only given bayonets with which to fight

questions.question: Was Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson a Union or Confederate general?
How did many northern Democrats feel about Lincoln's Emancipation Proclamation?

choices.answer: upset that slaves were not freed in the border states
felt the Proclamation went beyond the purpose of the War
in total agreement with Lincoln's decision to free slaves
felt that Lincoln was not harsh enough in punishing South

questions.question: What was Sherman's march across Georgia toward the Atlantic called?
Which of the following was an African American unit in the Civil War that attacked Fort Wagner?
What was the main topic of the Lincoln-Douglas debates?
Was Robert E. Lee a Union general or Confederate general?
Life for African Americans in the South changed after the Civil War because many

choices.answer: were now free because of the Emancipation Proclamation
received equal rights and opportunities under the law
gained respect of the white population of the South
won citizenship as a result of the Union victory in the War

questions.question: Why was the Battle of Gettysburg a turning point in the Civil War?

choices.answer: resulted in the Confederacy losing over half its troops
first time north believed they could win the War
scene of the Confederate surrender to the Union
marked the first clear Union victory of the Civil War

Was George B. McClellan a Union general or Confederate general?
Why did the South suffer most of the destruction during the Civil War?

choices.answer: most battles were fought in Georgia
most of the fighting took place there
schools and churches were used as hospitals
